description: Release target groups by attaching them to an ALB

mappers.Description: Allow EC2 Deployments to be hooked up to an ALB
Allow Lambda Deployments to be hooked up to an ALB

name: aws-alb

optionalFields.Synopsis: ARN for the certificate to install on the ALB listener
optionalFields.Summary: when this is set, the port automatically changes to 443 unless overriden in this configuration

optionalFields.Synopsis: Fully qualified domain name to set for the ALB
optionalFields.Summary: set along with zone_id to have DNS automatically setup for the ALB. this value should include the full hostname and domain name, for instance app.example.com

optionalFields.Synopsis: the ARN on an existing ALB to configure
optionalFields.Summary: when this is set, no ALB or Listener is created. Instead the application is configured by manipulating this existing Listener. This allows users to configure their ALB outside waypoint but still have waypoint hook the application to that ALB

optionalFields.Synopsis: the name to assign the ALB
optionalFields.Summary: names have to be unique per region

optionalFields.Synopsis: the TCP port to configure the ALB to listen on
the existing security groups to add to the ALB
optionalFields.Summary: a set of existing security groups to add to the ALB

optionalFields.Synopsis: the subnet ids to allow the ALB to run in
optionalFields.Default: public subnets in the account default VPC

optionalFields.Synopsis: Route53 ZoneID to create a DNS record into
optionalFields.Summary: set along with domain_name to have DNS automatically setup for the ALB
